definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: Modals go in front of the subject in questions.
sentences.chinese: 情態動詞置於主語之前構成疑問句。

sentences.english: I want you to change the affirmative sentence into an interrogative sentence.
sentences.chinese: 請你們把肯定句變化疑問句。

sentences.english: You use some question tags to make imperatives more polite.
sentences.chinese: 反意疑問句也用以使祈使句更禮貌。

sentences.english: The use of disjunctive questions in spoken English is rather changeable.
sentences.chinese: 英語口語中反意疑問句的運用比較靈活多變。

sentences.english: You normally use "much" in negative sentences and questions.
sentences.chinese: 一般用於否定句和疑問句中。

sentences.english: Wh-question is one of the interrogative forms both in English and Korean.
sentences.chinese: 特殊疑問句是英語和朝鮮語共有的一種疑問句形式。

sentences.english: Wh-question is one of the interrogative forms both in English and Korean.
sentences.chinese: 特殊疑問句是英語和朝鮮語共有的一種疑問句形式。

sentences.english: Notice the falling intonation of the doctor's Wh-questions.
sentences.chinese: 注意醫生提的特殊疑問句都用降調。

sentences.english: In English, some questions have a rising inflection.
sentences.chinese: 在英語中有些疑問句需要用升調。

sentences.english: Change the yes sentence into a damaging sentence or an interrogative sentence.
sentences.chinese: 將這個肯定句改爲否認句或疑問句。

sentences.english: The subject deletion in tag-question is a common phenomenon in informal English.
sentences.chinese: 正式語體中，反意疑問句中主語省略是很常見的現象。

sentences.english: Any, Not …Any and NoWe can answer these questions in two ways.
sentences.chinese: 可以用兩種不同的方式對以下疑問句作出否定的回答。

sentences.english: Tag questions are a form of polite speech.
sentences.chinese: 反意疑問句是一種禮貌用語。

sentences.english: Write negative answers to these questions in two different ways.
sentences.chinese: 用兩種不同的方式來對以下疑問句作出否定的回答。

sentences.english: Change the following sentences into general questions.
sentences.chinese: 把下面的句子變成一般疑問句。

definition: to get straight to the point (idiom)
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
